alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Northern Gila County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 18 at 9:25AM MST until August 18 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Arizona, north central Arizona and northeast Arizona, including the following areas, in east central Arizona, Northern Gila County. In north central Arizona, Eastern Mogollon Rim and Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County. In northeast Arizona, Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau, Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County, Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County, Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 and White Mountains. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. Consider changing your plans if you were going to hike, boat, or paddleboard to a slot canyon or normally dry wash. If you do still decide to recreate, check in at a nearby visitor center or ranger station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A westerly moving area of low pressure will enhance the probability of heavy rain and subsequent flash flooding over portions of northern Arizona from Friday through Saturday evening over areas that have already had significant rainfall over the past week. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
